basic.floral_language:
Phlox stolonifera 
Floriography: generous, quiet and beautiful, and welcome.
Phlox stolonifera is a short plant with cone shaped flowers on top of its stem. Color of flower are various, including pink, purple, red, rose red and mixed colors. The flower seats on five petals. Leaves are elongated round, green. It is usually planted in patches outdoor in yards, flower beds and parks or indoor for decoration.
This plant prefers mild sunlight, part shade tolerating, avoid direct sunlight in summer in growing. Flowering during May through October, lasts for two to three weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-October, viewing period 2-3 weeks
basic.color: Flower color purple, white, light red

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes moderate sunshine, also resistant to half shade
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, water daily in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and summer
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
